title: Reset scroll position to top on internal route navigation

requirements.summary: Reset window scroll position to (0,0) whenever navigating to a different route via internal links so destination pages load from the top.
acceptanceCriteria: From any page scrolled down, clicking a header navigation link (e.g., Services, About Us, Contact Us) navigates to the new route and places the user at the top of the page.
From any page scrolled down, clicking a footer quick link navigates to the new route and places the user at the top of the page.
From the Home page, clicking CTA links (e.g., "Get a Quote", "View Services") navigates and places the user at the top of the destination page.
The behavior applies consistently across all current routes: /, /about, /services, /tracking, /contact.

file_operations.description: Create a small, non-visual ScrollToTop component that listens for TanStack Router location changes (at least pathname changes) and calls window.scrollTo(0, 0) on navigation to ensure each destination route loads at the top.

Wire ScrollToTop into the shared layout so it runs for all routes (/, /about, /services, /tracking, /contact) without changing page designs; ensure placement covers navigation from header, footer, and in-page CTAs.
